meanings.definition: A member of a warlike Thessalian people led by Achilles at the siege of Troy.
meanings.sent1: In the ancient story, the myrmidons fought bravely alongside Achilles.
meanings.sent2: The myrmidons were known for their fierce loyalty to their leader.
meanings.sent3: The myrmidons decided to have a friendly competition to see who could run the fastest.
meanings.sent4: The myrmidons' unity in battle was as strong as a tightly woven shield.
meanings.sent5: The image of the myrmidons charging into battle is etched in history books.

meanings.definition: A loyal follower, especially one who executes orders without question.
meanings.sent1: As a myrmidon of the boss, he carried out tasks diligently and without hesitation.
meanings.sent2: The CEO's myrmidons ensured that all instructions were followed to the letter.
meanings.sent3: The myrmidons organized a surprise party for their leader to show their loyalty.
meanings.sent4: She was a myrmidon of fashion, always following the latest trends.
meanings.sent5: The myrmidons' dedication to their cause was unwavering and admirable.
